newsitem.title: USA: Iomega cuts external/internal Jaz price.
newsitem.headline: Iomega cuts external/internal Jaz price.

text.p: Iomega Corp said Thursday it has reduced the minimum advertised price of its Jaz drives products by $100.
Beginning May 1, the street price of the internal Jaz drive will drop to $299 from $399, and the external model will be slashed to $399 from $499.

"With the new, low price of the Jaz drive, we are making it even easier for today's power users to add unlimited storage capacity to their PCs," said George Krieger, general manager, Iomega professional products division.

The company said its pricing initiative will be augmented by a national print advertising campaign. Outside the United States, price adjustments will be determined with Iomega's international channel partners and will be effective beginning May 19, it said.

Iomega provides personal computer storage solutions that help people manage their computer stuff anywhere, including Zip drives and disks; Jaz one-gigabyte drives and disks; Ditto tape backup drives and tape cartridges; and the Bernoulli line of removable drives and disks.
